channel.title: Pirvate server over LAN only
channel.description:
i need help figuring out how exactly to run a private server over a LAN without internet. I downloaded the client/server pack, so i've got a client and a server, and i have downloaded the cache separately. i have tried following the tutorials, and just skipping the no-ip part, but it doesn't seem to wanna work for me.
in short, is there something specific i need to do to allow a purely local private game to run? [u][b]there will not be any internet connection at all on any computer connected to this network[/b][/u].[br][size=1]Posted on: June 22, 2007, 06:02:30 PM[/size][hr]i guess i should mention that when i run my server, then my client, it gets to the "connecting" portion then freezes. i forgot the error the moparscape client said, it was something about "bob" and the number 20 at the end...

item.title: Pirvate server over LAN only
item.dc:creator: @agent0002 agent0002
item.description:
@agent0002 wrote:

no it is not solved that simply. if it could be, why would i be asking for help…and besides the fact that that would be completely defeating the point of setting up a private RS server on a LAN without internet.

i plugged in an AOL disc so that i could get free internet temporarily and try it online anyway, to see if it would be different. I get the same error (error: loaderror bobStarting up 20) that i do without being connected to the internet.

lets take it one step at a time. does anyone know what the “error: loaderror bobStarting up 20” error means, and how to correct it?[br][size=1]Posted on: June 25, 2007, 09:56:17 PM[/size][hr]i don’t think it makes a difference, but my java version i have installed is jre1.6.0_01 and jdk1.6.0_01

Read full topic

item.title: Pirvate server over LAN only
item.dc:creator: @kepoly kepoly
item.description:
@kepoly wrote:

get internet on the computer and your problem is solved jeesh.

Read full topic

item.title: Pirvate server over LAN only
item.dc:creator: @agent0002 agent0002
item.description:
@agent0002 wrote:

the computers that i am trying to use moparscape on DO NOT HAVE AN INTERNET CONNECTION

this is the key part of the whole thing i believe.

all of the moparscape things, the client+server+cache, were downloaded seperately onto a flash drive and put onto the computers on this LAN network.

Read full topic

item.title: Pirvate server over LAN only
item.dc:creator: @Tico135 Tico
item.description:
@Tico135 wrote:

Try deleting MoparScape from your computer and re-downloading it. If that doesn’t work then it is definatley your internet speed.

Read full topic

item.title: Pirvate server over LAN only
item.dc:creator: @agent0002 agent0002
item.description:
@agent0002 wrote:

uhh…gigabit LAN is not too slow…not for less then 5 clients on 1 server…

i should mention that the computer i am running the server on is the computer i built with 1,000$ worth of parts. performance IS NOT an issue. thats not what the problem is.

the error i get with the moparscape client is:
error: loaderror bobStarting up 20[br][size=1]Posted on: June 24, 2007, 09:42:19 PM[/size][hr]the “error: loaderror bobStarting up 20” is with both the webclient and the downloaded one. my server DOS box has a line that reads ClientHandler: Accepted from localhost:1492, after i hit new server–>localhost in the client.

Read full topic

item.title: Pirvate server over LAN only
item.dc:creator: @Tico135 Tico
item.description:
@Tico135 wrote:

If you are on LAN, give up. It is way too slow. Sorry.

Read full topic
